intro: Draba sakuraii var. nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese rockcress, is a small flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. This variant is distinguished by its compact growth habit and pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. The plant is well adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of central and northern Japan.
